title: 112_hr3163
content: The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" establishes a minimum early voting period for jurisdictions conducting early voting under the Help America Vote Act of 2002. This new section outlines requirements for states permitting early voting. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" sets a 14-day early voting period for states allowing early voting for Federal elections. States must comply with these requirements starting January 1, 2012. Additionally, the Act prohibits states from mandating state-issued identification for voting or voter registration. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" prohibits states from requiring state-issued identification for voting or voter registration. The "Easy Voting Act of 2011" prohibits election officials from requiring state-issued identification for voting or voter registration in federal elections, effective January 1, 2012. SEC. 4. REQUIRING STATES TO MAKE SAME-DAY VOTER REGISTRATION AND CHANGE OF ADDRESS SERVICE AVAILABLE. This section amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to include Election Day registration and change of address service. Each State must allow individuals to register and vote on the day of a Federal election at the polling place. If a registered voter moves within the State without updating their address, they can provide the new address at the polling place to cast a vote in a Federal election. Individuals can provide their new address at the polling place to cast a regular ballot in a Federal election. States must transmit voter registration forms and change of address forms to State election officials. Each State must comply with the requirements of this section starting January 1, 2012. A clerical amendment is made to the table of contents of the Act. Section 303C of the Act allows for Election Day registration and change of address service. This provision also applies to early voting sites in states that allow voting prior to a Federal election.
